patient_info: Ovarian cyst,Abnormal vagina morphology,Abnormality of the breast,Cafe-au-lait spot,Accelerated skeletal maturation,Premature thelarche,Polyostotic fibrous dysplasia,Monostotic fibrous dysplasia,Pain,Increased serum estradiol,Decreased circulating follicle stimulating hormone concentration,Decreased circulating luteinizing hormone level,Enlarged tonsils,Increased size of nasopharyngeal adenoids,Metrorrhagia,Enlarged uterus
golden_diagnosis: McCune-Albright 综合征/McCune-Albright syndrome; MAS/McCune-Albright syndrome/McCune-Albright syndrome, somatic, mosaic,McCune-Albright 综合征/McCune-Albright syndrome; MAS/McCune-Albright syndrome/McCune-Albright syndrome, somatic, mosaic,McCune-Albright 综合征/McCune-Albright syndrome; MAS/McCune-Albright syndrome/McCune-Albright syndrome, somatic, mosaic
predict_diagnosis:
Step 1: The patient's symptoms of ovarian cyst, abnormal vagina morphology, and accelerated skeletal maturation can be indicative of a rare genetic disorder called Turner syndrome.
Step 2: The patient's breast abnormality and cafe-au-lait spots can be indicative of a rare genetic disorder called neurofibromatosis type 1.
Step 3: The patient's premature thelarche and polyostotic fibrous dysplasia can be indicative of a rare genetic disorder called Marfan syndrome.
Step 4: The patient's monostotic fibrous dysplasia and enlarged tonsils and nasopharyngeal adenoids can be indicative of a rare genetic disorder called Cowden syndrome.
Step 5: The patient's metrorrhagia and enlarged uterus can be indicative of a rare genetic disorder called Mayer-Rokitansky-Küster-Hauser syndrome.
Step 6: The patient's increased serum estradiol and decreased circulating follicle-stimulating hormone concentration can be indicative of a rare genetic disorder called ovarian hypoplasia, type 1.
Step 7: The patient's decreased circulating luteinizing hormone level can be indicative of a rare genetic disorder called hypogonadotropic hypogonadism.
Step 8: The patient's pain can be indicative of a rare genetic disorder called Ehlers-Danlos syndrome.
Step 9: The patient's enlarged uterus can be indicative of a rare genetic disorder called uterine hypoplasia.
Step 10: The patient's rare genetic disorder can be any of the above-mentioned diagnoses, as the symptoms and signs are not specific to any one disorder.
Therefore, the final diagnosis is [Turner syndrome,Neurofibromatosis type 1,Marfan syndrome,Cowden syndrome,Mayer-Rokitansky-Küster-Hauser syndrome,Ovarian hypoplasia, type 1,Hypogonadotropic hypogonadism,Ehlers-Danlos syndrome,Uterine hypoplasia].
